title: Drawing, "Design for a Painted Porcelain Tureen and Tray", ca. 1750
medium: Brush and watercolor, black chalk on cream laid paper
markings: Stamp:  Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration in black, lower center right and lower right corner, verso:  Lugt no. 457d
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and brown ink, upper left:  N° 1er./Terine ovale 2e Grandeur/prix avec le plateau 264."; center left:  N°2/Plateau de la Saussiere/seul 18".; in graphite, lower left verso:  P. 14
provenance:
From the Collection of Giovanni Piancastelli
Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Covered tureen shown in elevation (above) with tray (below).  Tureen with ovoid bowl on foliated legs from which rise rod-shaped handles with entwined bands of ribbon and leaves. Floral sprays in yellow, red and blue of roses, ranuculluses, and daisies on the body of the bowl, cover, and tray; cover with floral knop. Lozenge-shaped tray with floral decoration and bands.

participants.person_name: French National Porcelain Manufactury at Vincennes

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Design for a Painted Porcelain Tureen and Tray", ca. 1750.Brush and watercolor, black chalk on cream laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-8315.
